headline: These 5 Software Stocks Prove Profitability Beats Growth in 2026
summary: Software stocks have split into two camps in 2026. The winners are printing money with expanding margins and accelerating growth. The losers are treading water despite solid execution. What separates them? Profitability at scale, not just revenue growth. The market is done rewarding unprofitable expansion. It has started paying premiums for companies that convert dominance ... These 5 Software Stocks Prove Profitability Beats Growth in 2026

headline: 2 Software Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 We Brush Off
summary: Software is eating the world, and virtually no business is left untouched by it. In the past, the undeniable tailwinds fueling SaaS companies led to lofty valuation multiples that made it easier to raise capital. But this was a double-edged sword as the high prices exposed them to big drawdowns, and unfortunately, the industry has tumbled by 4.6% over the last six months. This performance is a noticeable divergence from the S&P 500’s 10.8% return.

headline: Guggenheim Lifts Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Rating Following Deal Activity and AI Tailwinds
summary: Palo Alto Networks, Inc. (NASDAQ:PANW) is one of the AI Stocks Making Waves on Wall Street. headline: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) Valuation Check After Recent Share Price Pullback
summary: Palo Alto Networks (PANW) is back on investors’ radar after recent trading left the stock about 6.5% lower over the past month and roughly 14.7% lower over the past 3 months, prompting fresh interest in its valuation. See our latest analysis for Palo Alto Networks. Looking beyond the recent pullback, Palo Alto Networks’ 30 day share price return of a 6.5% decline and 90 day share price return of a 14.7% decline contrast with a positive year to date share price return of 3.6%. The 1 year total...
